alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 12:06PM CDT until March 27 at 10:31PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1205 PM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported numerous flooded roadways due to previous heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen, with an additional 1 to 2 inches possible with additional rainfall through this afternoon. - This includes the following low water crossings... South Fork Jacks Fork River at Stillhouse Road, North Fork River at Highway EE, North Prong Jacks Fork at Arroll Road, Boone Creek at Boone Creek Road, Little Piney River at Union Road, Big Piney River at Cleveland Road and Rock Creek at Rock Creek Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
